org.getspout.spoutapi.packet
Interface SpoutPacket

All Known Subinterfaces:
CompressablePacket
All Known Implementing Classes:
GenericCubeCustomBlock, GenericCuboidCustomBlock, GenericCustomBlock, GenericCustomFood, GenericCustomItem, GenericCustomTool, PacketAddonData, PacketAirTime, PacketAlert, PacketAllowVisualCheats, PacketBiomeWeather, PacketBlockData, PacketCacheDeleteFile, PacketCacheFile, PacketCacheHashUpdate, PacketChunkRefresh, PacketClipboardText, PacketControlAction, PacketCustomBlockChunkOverride, PacketCustomBlockDesign, PacketCustomBlockOverride, PacketCustomMultiBlockOverride, PacketDownloadMusic, PacketEntityInformation, PacketEntitySkin, PacketEntityTitle, PacketFullVersion, PacketItemName, PacketKeyBinding, PacketKeyPress, PacketMovementModifiers, PacketMusicChange, PacketNotification, PacketOpenScreen, PacketOpenSignGUI, PacketPlaySound, PacketPreCacheCompleted, PacketPreCacheFile, PacketRenderDistance, PacketScreenAction, PacketScreenshot, PacketServerPlugins, PacketSetVelocity, PacketSkinURL, PacketSky, PacketStopMusic, PacketTexturePack, PacketWidget, PacketWidgetRemove
public interface SpoutPacket

Method Detail

getNumBytes

int getNumBytes()
The number of bytes of data contained inside of the packet. Packet version and other meta-data are excluded, only count bytes read by readData(DataInputStream).

Returns:
Number of bytes

readData

void readData(DataInputStream input)
              throws IOException
Reads the data from an input stream into member variables. The number of bytes read must be equal to the result of getNumBytes().

Parameters:
input - stream to read from
Throws:
IOException

writeData

void writeData(DataOutputStream output)
               throws IOException
Writes the data from the packet to the output stream, to be serialized and sent to a player. The number of bytes written must be equal to the result of getNumBytes().

Parameters:
output - stream to write to
Throws:
IOException

run

void run(int playerId)
Performs any tasks for the packet after data has been successfully read into the packet.

Parameters:
playerId - for the packet

failure

void failure(int playerId)
Performs any tasks for the packet after the data has NOT been successfully read into the packet. All values will be at defaults (0, null, etc) and are unsafe. Failure is run when the packet versions mismatch and data could not be safely read. It may not be called for all cases of failure.

Parameters:
playerId -

getPacketType

PacketType getPacketType()
The type of packet represented. Used to rebuild the correct packet on the client.

Returns:
packet type.

getVersion

int getVersion()
Version of the packet this represents. Version numbers should start with 0. Versions should be incremented any time the member variables or serialization of the packet changes, to prevent crashing. Mismatched packet versions are discarded, and failure(int) is called.

Returns:
version
